transcript.speaker: Harsh Bansal
transcript.text: Okay. So the agenda for this meeting is discussing the role of

transcript.speaker: Harsh Bansal
transcript.text: individual team members in the hosting of the last club event. So

transcript.speaker: Harsh Bansal
transcript.text: in the last club event, it was pretty evident that the participation was lower than

transcript.speaker: Harsh Bansal
transcript.text: We were expecting around eighty participants to show up

transcript.speaker: Harsh Bansal
transcript.text: We had called sixty five people, and they said they'll come.

transcript.speaker: Harsh Bansal
transcript.text: But we only saw twenty people show up in the event.

transcript.speaker: Harsh Bansal
transcript.text: First thing to notice here is that

transcript.speaker: Harsh Bansal
transcript.text: despite calling the

transcript.speaker: Harsh Bansal
transcript.text: people who showed up were very less. So how come this was

transcript.speaker: Harsh Bansal
transcript.text: possible? Are people lying on calls or

transcript.speaker: Harsh Bansal
transcript.text: why are they not truthful about their participation when we call them to ask

transcript.speaker: Harsh Bansal
transcript.text: So we need to rethink about how we are approaching the people who are

transcript.speaker: Harsh Bansal
transcript.text: participating in our events. Secondly,

transcript.speaker: Harsh Bansal
transcript.text: when we already know that participation can fall, what

transcript.speaker: Harsh Bansal
transcript.text: measures had we taken to ensure that this does not happen?

transcript.speaker: Harsh Bansal
transcript.text: And it did happen, and the event was a total mess.

transcript.speaker: Harsh Bansal
transcript.text: Yet, it is pretty commendable that we were able to manage twenty people

transcript.speaker: Harsh Bansal
transcript.text: and we were able to engage them in the activity that the event was supposed to

transcript.speaker: Harsh Bansal
transcript.text: conduct. So

transcript.speaker: Harsh Bansal
transcript.text: on that part, pretty good performance, but

transcript.speaker: Harsh Bansal
transcript.text: more is expected, and participation has always been a problem for us.

transcript.speaker: Harsh Bansal
transcript.text: And so we need to

transcript.speaker: Harsh Bansal
transcript.text: really look into why was

transcript.speaker: Harsh Bansal
transcript.text: this happening earlier as well and why this is

transcript.speaker: Harsh Bansal
transcript.text: happening in our current and upcoming events.

transcript.speaker: Harsh Bansal
transcript.text: Now the next point that I want to bring to note is that

transcript.speaker: Harsh Bansal
transcript.text: even our own coordinators don't show up in the events properly.

transcript.speaker: Harsh Bansal
transcript.text: So when we ask for volunteers to

transcript.speaker: Harsh Bansal
transcript.text: come and volunteer for

transcript.speaker: Harsh Bansal
transcript.text: us in coordinating the events. We do receive many

transcript.speaker: Harsh Bansal
transcript.text: people who are interested

transcript.speaker: Harsh Bansal
transcript.text: But eventually, when it comes to the event and doing tasks, people

transcript.speaker: Harsh Bansal
transcript.text: show up, mark their attendances, and go away.

transcript.speaker: Harsh Bansal
transcript.text: From what I suspect, is primarily because of

transcript.speaker: Harsh Bansal
transcript.text: the fact that we give free attendance to the volunteers.

transcript.speaker: Harsh Bansal
transcript.text: And so people have found a way to, you know,

transcript.speaker: Harsh Bansal
transcript.text: get around classes, but

transcript.speaker: Harsh Bansal
transcript.text: showing up as a volunteer but not doing the work. So we need to strategize on this and make

transcript.speaker: Harsh Bansal
transcript.text: sure that this does not happen

transcript.speaker: Harsh Bansal
transcript.text: again and again. And

transcript.speaker: Harsh Bansal
transcript.text: with this, I think we can wrap this meeting up and

transcript.speaker: Harsh Bansal
transcript.text: let's try to you know,

transcript.speaker: Harsh Bansal
transcript.text: have a more healthy conversation on how we can improve our

transcript.speaker: Harsh Bansal
transcript.text: participation as well as performance in volunteering. I hope everyone agrees on this. So thank you, and bye bye.

summary: The meeting focused on the low participation and disengagement issues experienced during the last club event. Despite expecting 80 participants and confirming 65, only 20 showed up. This highlights a problem with how potential attendees are approached and their commitment. Additionally, a significant issue was raised regarding the lack of commitment from event coordinators themselves, with volunteers signing up but not fulfilling their duties, possibly due to the incentive of free attendance. The discussion emphasized the need to re-evaluate recruitment strategies and implement measures to ensure both attendee and volunteer accountability for future events.
key_points: Rethink the approach to engaging people for event participation due to lack of truthful responses.
Investigate why participation falls and what measures were taken (or not taken) to prevent it.
Acknowledge the success in managing and engaging the 20 attendees despite overall event issues.
Recognize that low participation is a recurring problem that needs to be addressed for current and upcoming events.
Address the issue of coordinators not showing up properly for events after volunteering.
Hypothesize that offering free attendance to volunteers might be a reason for people signing up but not performing tasks.
Develop a strategy to ensure volunteers actively participate and complete their assigned tasks.

action_items.description: Investigate the discrepancy between expected and actual participant turnout for the last club event.
Determine if participants who confirmed attendance are not showing up or if there was an issue with communication.
Rethink the approach for engaging people for club events to improve participation.
Implement measures to ensure higher participation in club events, even when initial interest is low.

"description": "Ensure coordinators attend and volunteer for club events.",

"description": "Implement measures to ensure participant turnout meets expectations for future events.",

"description": "Develop a strategy to ensure volunteers actively contribute to event coordination tasks.",
